The movie's runtime was extended, and they didn't have the time to sit through it. They skipped the movie because it was too long
The restaurant had a formal dress code and upscale ambiance that he wasn't comfortable with. He avoided the restaurant because it was too fancy
The restaurant menu had high prices that were above his dining budget. He avoided the restaurant because it was too pricey
The project had too many tasks and details to handle, causing stress. She didn't complete the project because it was too overwhelming
The project required more time and dedication than she could spare. She didn't complete the project because it was too time-consuming
The gift size was too insignificant and not what he expected. He returned the gift because it was too small
The gift lacked thought and meaning, feeling generic and unconnected to him. He returned the gift because it was too impersonal
The party had loud music and noise levels that were overwhelming. She avoided the party because it was too loud
The party was packed with people, leaving little space to move around comfortably. She avoided the party because it was too crowded
The road trip distance was significant, requiring more time than they had available. They decided against the road trip because it was too long
The road trip expenses, such as fuel and accommodation, were higher than their budget allowed. They decided against the road trip because it was too costly
